ratings.comment: Amazing professor. Goes slow and seems to really care for her students. Tests are on the harder side, but overall it was a good class.
Tests on material not covered in homework or class. Would have failed twice had I not withdrawn at the last second. I went to a different school and got an A no problem. Terrible teacher and class.

Good prof, the TAs were a bit messy, and the discussion involves weekly quizzes, but Rivard is available for office hours and grades fairly. Also, she will gladly give you extra points if you show your work, even if you make mistakes. Not too hard a class if you show up and pay attention!
This professor is a kindred spirit. She is an excellent teacher; clear, caring, and challenging. She truly cares about her students and is very accessible and easy to talk to. 100/10 would recommend.

Great professor in lecture. Class grade is highly based off of midterms/exams like most math classes. One recommendation is study hard for the first midterm so you're not behind the whole semester. Also the textbook was pointless because there were tutorials online.
Love her she's seriously so adorable and a really great teacher.

GREAT MATH PROFESSOR. If you go to class, you will pass. Always willing to help. Plenty of office hours. Homework is manageable. Tests are not too hard if you study. She's funny and always there when you need help. Didn't open the textbook once, I would not buy it if I were you. It's not necessary.

Lectures are easy to follow but the homework doesn't really line up with what she teaches. Final was a little unfair but overall her expectations are pretty clear. Grade can also be drastically effected by which TA you have because of the weekly quizzes. Pretty easy course if you put in a lot of work
She's a great math teacher. Her lectures aren't boring and she teaches the material really well. She has a slight French accent, but it's really not bad. You never use the textbook.

I struggled a lot with math before coming to college, but Diane's method of teaching worked great for me. She  is clear with her expectations for you, and gives thorough study guides for all of the exams. She is incredibly organized, very fair, and transparent. If you do everything she says to there is no reason you shouldn't get an A !

She is one of the best professors I have had at UW do far and really keep math interesting for me. Her class isn't easy but she is clear on what is going to be on the exams. She genuinely care about her students. I would definitely take math with her again if I had the chance.

Diane was an incredibly fair professor. Her lectures were straightforward and prepared us well for the exam. She explained exactly what was on each exam and had a more than fair curve. She was a genuinely nice woman and cared about our success.
I loved this class! Diane genuinely cares about students, and she explains all of the concepts really well. I definitely recommend her as a professor!

This class was a breeze because I have a good background of math. But this professor made going to lectures worth it. There isn't much memorizing of equations and if she expects you to, she proves it first. There are weekly quizzes and plenty of review sheets to prepare for tests that are equally easy. Plus Mrs. Rivard is adorable!

Honestly, I struggled in this class. Math has never been my thing and this class proved that.... but Diane was very sweet and helpful. Her lecture style had nothing to do with my performance in the class. She was very helpful in office hours and all the students respected her. 114 isn't the most fun class around, but Diane makes it way better.

Diane is great! The class can be challenging, but that can go for any math class. She offers many opportunities to get extra help. Two midterms, a finals, and weekly quizzes. Homework isn't due but you go over it in discussion. Definitely suggest her!

If you have taken both Algebra and Trig the concepts are pretty clear and does not require a ton of extra studying.  Gives study guides and answers that pretty much prepare you for the tests.  Lectures are a bit dry, but that is math!  Gave plenty of opportunities for office hours before exams.

She is very sweet and explains the material well. She is there to help whenever necessary and gives you the guidance you need in order to be successful. Definitely an easy class, homework is not collected or graded.
She is very sweet and really cares about your success. Her office hours are very helpful.

Diane is honestly the best math instructor I have ever had. She makes everything so easy to understand, and her pace is perfect. She focuses her class on doing group work to ensure that you understand the concepts. Plus, she's an absolute sweetheart.

Although she is very good at explaining basic concepts, it is very easy to get out of depth as soon as you try to do the homework. Classes were frustratingly repetitive, and a lot of effort is required if you want a good grade for what should be an easy class.
Professor Rivard was great! I am not a math superstar, but I was very confident in that class as she was incredibly helpful and clear in her teaching. Added plus: her accent is beautiful

Diane Rivard is listed as the teacher for this class, but we never saw her. We were only taught by the TA. I think the structure of this class is pretty horrible. It seems like they have been steadily trying to improve it though, so hopefully it actually gets better. One nice thing is if you get an A on the exams you don't have to come to class.
Great teacher.  I am not good at math, at all.  I did well in her class because she was a really good teacher.  She explained things extremely clearly.
Great professor!
